title: WARNING: You HAVE to use your real number
text:
Read ahead for those with kids: To sign up for WhatsApp, you have to share your real phone number. This is forced because on sign up they uses carrier pinging through 2FA to ensure you‚Äôre using your real number and not a burner. 

And that‚Äôs just where it starts. 

Now, the only way to have others contact you is with your real number. All your contacts see your real number, any one you chat to can see your real number. This is dangerous because even if you block and unsavory chat, that person still has your actual number. If that person is blocked on the app, they can still call, text, and harass whomever is on the other line. 

I immediately had my family delete their accounts and private data from Facebook/WhatsApp. 

If you value your families privacy or your own, here‚Äôs my recommendations for apps that do actually care about user privacy:
Signal, Telegram, Wire

Do better Facebook.
